result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Levi B. Krimmer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Levi B. Krimmer in court, in custody with attorney Gabriel G. Siehr.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 16CF10, 16CF45, 15CM258  @ 2:36 pm.  State gives plea agreement 16CF45 plea to ct's  1, 2 & 6 remaining DRI ct 1 - 6 months jail, consecutive, costs, ct 2 - 8 years prison, 2 yrs 6 months initial confinement,  5 yrs 6 months extended supervision, consecutive, costs, ct 6 time served, costs,  16CF10  plea to charge, 60 days jail consecutive, costs 15CM258 DRI, Def. has agreed to forfeit of $100.00.  Money that has been seized of time of arrest will be returned to Levi to go towards costs.  Atty Siehr and def agrees with plea agreement.  Plea questionnaire and waiver of rights filed. Def. understands charges and penalties. 16CF10 Fleeing, Guilty, 16CF45 Ct 1 Fleeing, Guilty, ct 2 poss w/intent amphetamine, ptac w/weapon, guilty plea, ct 6 resisting w/weapon, Guilty, 15CM258 DRI, 16CF45 Ct's 3, 4 5 & 7 DRI.  Def. advised of constitutional rights & J.T. rights.  Def. understands elements. recess @ 2:49 pm. reconvene @ 2:53 pm.  Atty Siehr is satisfied.  Court finds pleas are freely & voluntarily given.  Factual basis stipulated.  Court finds factual basis, accepts pleas and finds def. Guilty to Fleeing in 16CF10 and 16CF45 Ct 1 Fleeing, Ct 2 Poss w/intent deliver amphetamine, ptac, w/weapon, Ct 6 Resisting w/weapon. State gives sentencing recommendation.  Atty Siehr gives sentencing recommendation. Def. makes statement.  Court accepts plea agreement and orders
16CF10 - 60 days jail, consecutive, costs, 250 DNA Surcharge, Bond in 15CM258 Court will not forfeit and apply to costs in 16CF10, Cash that was seized, no forfeiture proceeding start, to be returned to def. however to apply to costs in both cases. 15CM258  500 bond to be to 16CF10 
16CF45 - Ct 1 - 6 months jail, consecutive to 16CF10, costs,  250 DNA surcharge, DNA Sample, money left over apply to ct 1, if any left over apply to ct 6
Ct 2 - 8 years prison, 2 1/2 years initial confinement, 5 1/2 years extended supervision, consecutive to 16CF10 & ct 1, costs, 250 DNA surcharge
Ct 6 -  114 days jail, consecutive to other sentences, time served deemed completed, costs, 200 DNA Surcharge.
Def. is eligible for Challenge & Substance Program. Def. advised of firearm and voting rights. Court heard on payment plan and Default, court may delay or convert to civil judgment.  Def. would like to delay pp.  Court directs Clerk to put payment plan on hold. Def. would like cases to be converted to civil judgment.  Court will convert p.p and Default to civil judgment in 14CM236, 15TR695, 15TR732, 15CM172, 15TR957, 15TR956, 16TR57. Def. advised of postconviction rights. 15CM172 Expungement was reserved.  State objects to expungement.  Def. has nothing.  Court denies expungement.

Defendant Levi B. Krimmer in court, in custody, via-video with attorney Gabriel G. Siehr.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court calls 15CM258, 16CF10 & 16CF45  @ 1:47 pm.  No agreement reached on bond.  Atty Siehr gives argument on bail bond.  If defendant was released has a job only thing different on motion.  State gives argument. Atty Siehr responds to high bond.  Judge gives statement, Court will not adjust bail, but if family comes up with no less than 10,000 will hear again, but may not even agree to that. Motion is denied.
to Withdraw and for appointment of Substitute Counsel - see 16CF10

Defendant Levi B. Krimmer in court, in custody with attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court calls 16CF45, 15CM258, 16CF10  @ 10:19 am.  Atty Abernethy-Mays is representing def. 15CM258 is on for Status & Bail/Bond Forfeiture, CF's on for p.h.  Waiver of preliminary examination filed.  Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.  Court accepts waiver and finds probable cause & binds over. Information Filed. Atty Abernethy-Mays has copy of informations on each file, waives reading, reserve rights, & enters Not Guilty 16CF10 Ct 1 & 16CF45 ct's 1-7.  Court receives Not Guilty pleas on both cases.  Atty Abernethy- Mays request speedy demand. Court advised need to file in writing. State moves to forfeit bond in 15CM258, Court will order forfeiture pending hearing. Atty Abernethy-Mays gives argument on bond.  State gives bond argument.  Court gives reason for ruling, Court feels mute point, Court will hear if somebody will come up with $50,000 Atty Abernethy-Mays can contact Court.  Status conference scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Levi B. Krimmer
Current: 1021 Lincoln Strret # 5, Antigo, WI 54409 United States  (Effective: 01-25-2016)
Prior: 915 North Deresch Street, Antigo, WI 54409

Defendant Levi B. Krimmer in court with attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called 16CF10 and 15CM258.  State moves to vacate warrant in 16CF10.  Court will vacate warrants.  15CM258 bond forfeiture for $100.00 bond.  Atty Abernethy-Mays would like adjourned.  Complaint received.  Waive reading.  15CM258 Reserve jurisdicational objections, and enter not guilty plea.  Court will receive plea.  16CF10 Bond, State request the $500. cash bond be applied to both files.  Court will order that the $500. cash bond apply to both files.  Time limits for preliminary waived.  Court reviews right to preliminary within time limits.  Def waives time limits  Status conference scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Levi B. Krimmer not in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Def has posted $100.00 bond and given todays date.  State moves to forfeit bond.  Warrant with $500.00 bond or body.  Court will forfeit bond ,pending hearing.  Warrant authorized, adjacent counties
